notes.text:
This update for gnutls fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2020-13777: Fixed an insecure session ticket key construction which could 
  have made the TLS server to not bind the session ticket encryption key with a
  value supplied by the application until the initial key rotation, allowing
  an attacker to bypass authentication in TLS 1.3 and recover previous
  conversations in TLS 1.2 (bsc#1172506).
- Fixed an  improper handling of certificate chain with cross-signed intermediate
  CA certificates (bsc#1172461).
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: GnuTLS 3.6.x before 3.6.14 uses incorrect cryptography for encrypting a session ticket (a loss of confidentiality in TLS 1.2, and an authentication bypass in TLS 1.3). The earliest affected version is 3.6.4 (2018-09-24) because of an error in a 2018-09-18 commit. Until the first key rotation, the TLS server always uses wrong data in place of an encryption key derived from an application.
